questions.text: When was Cathy Roxeanne Rigby born?
questions.explanation:
December 12, 1952.

	Cathy Rigby was born in Los Alamitos, California at 6:45pm PST. Cathy Rigby is 4'11".

questions.text: What year did Cathy Rigby first perform in the Olympics?
questions.explanation:
1968.

	Cathy Rigby first went to the Olympics in 1968 and again in 1972, where she became the first American woman to win a medal in gymnastics.

questions.text: What year was she nominated for a Tony Award?
questions.explanation:
1991.

	She was nominated for Best Actress in a Musical Revival for "Peter Pan". However, she did not win the award that year.  The winner was Lea Salonga for "Miss Saigon".

questions.text: What character was Cathy Rigby best known for playing?
questions.explanation:
Peter Pan.

	Other women to have played the role include: Mary Martin, Mia Farrow and Betty Bronson. Cathy Rigby first played the role in 1974. She played it on Broadway in 1991.  Her farewell tour was in 2005-2006.

questions.text: In 1981, she made her professional debut. What was the musical?
questions.explanation:
The Wizard of Oz.

	She was Dorothy in "The Wizard of Oz". During this show she met her second husband Tom McCoy.

questions.text: Cathy Rigby was an Olympic gymnast.  How many gold international medals did she win?
questions.explanation:
8.

	She won 12 international medals all together. One of the medals she won was the silver medal in 1970 for the balance beam at the World Champions.

questions.text: Who did Cathy Rigby play in Broadway's "Seussical the Musical" from 2000-2001?
questions.explanation:
Cat in the Hat.

	She replaced David Shiner in the role. Cathy Rigby said she would have liked to play the part longer, but the show actually closed on May 20, 2001.

questions.text: When was Cathy Rigby married to Tom McCoy?
questions.explanation:
September 11.

	They were married in 1982. Cathy Rigby and her husband, Tom McCoy founded McCoy Rigby Entertainment. They produce shows in the La Mirada Theatre in La Mirada, California.

questions.text: Cathy Rigby once suffered from Anorexia.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Cathy Rigby once suffered from Bulimia after her gymnastic career ended.

questions.text: What award did she receive in 2004?
questions.explanation:
Distinguished Lifetime Service Award.

	Cathy Rigby supports the Special Olympics, the Long Beach Aquarium by the Sea, and the Peter Pan Children's Fund.
